segments.speaker: SL
segments.text: The mountains stand ahead of you, quiet and ominous. The strange ley-line still hums nearby—wrong, hollow, like something missing where power should be.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: We shouldn’t stay. The land is wounded, and whatever caused it is still out there. The mountains will not wait for us.

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: I agree. Whatever twisted this ley-line is still active. I want to see where it leads… preferably without dying.

segments.speaker: Glymbar
segments.text: Mountains, monsters, maybe treasure. Works for me.

segments.speaker: Sherkan
segments.text: As long as something tries to kill us, I’m happy.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: (removing his mask respectfully) We’re leaving. We chase the threat instead of waiting for it to return here. There was talk of a bridge. Is it still intact?

segments.speaker: Tsa Priestess
segments.text: Yes. You can cross safely. And yes… we feel it too. The air is wrong now. Since the tree fell, everything has changed.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: Then it began the day everything broke.

segments.speaker: Tsa Priestess
segments.text: I believe so. And I believe you’re the ones meant to face it.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: Then we’ll do what we can. Protect your people. Guard the new sapling. And pray your enemy does not come before we return.

segments.speaker: Tsa Priestess
segments.text: May the gods walk beside you.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: There’s a bridge. No more excuses.

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: Good. The curiosity is killing me faster than the danger.

segments.speaker: Glymbar
segments.text: Still unholy, this movement spell of yours. Useful… but unholy.

segments.speaker: Sherkan
segments.text: Don’t complain. You can swing your axe longer.

segments.speaker: Glymbar
segments.text: That’s what scares me.

segments.speaker: SL
segments.text: The bridge stands untouched, stone strong beneath your feet though its railings are shattered. The river snarls below, but the path forward is clear.

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: The ley-line doesn’t follow the bridge. It runs beside it. Straight. Uncaring. Wrong.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: So we follow the wrongness.

segments.speaker: Sherkan
segments.text: That’s been our specialty lately.

segments.speaker: SL
segments.text: After some travel, the nature near the ley-line shifts. Grass grows in warped shapes. Bushes twist. Branches bend like broken fingers reaching for something that isn’t there.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: This isn’t random. The world doesn’t grow like this.

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: That’s… not just decay. That’s intent.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: Could it be writing?

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: …Let me look.

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: It looks like Zhayad. But it isn’t. It pretends to be. It’s like someone who knows how letters should look but has never actually learned to write.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: Meaning?

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: Meaning this is imitation. Corruption trying to masquerade as logic. And everything it says comes down to one idea: merging things that were never meant to be merged.

segments.speaker: Sherkan
segments.text: Chimera magic.

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: Exactly.

segments.speaker: Glymbar
segments.text: (picks a berry, bites it, immediately spits it out) By the ancestors! That tastes like regret!

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: Try not to eat the cursed wilderness next time.

segments.speaker: Glymbar
segments.text: I was hungry.

segments.speaker: Sherkan
segments.text: If your beard falls off, I’m not helping.

segments.speaker: SL
segments.text: The land shifts as you move. Hills give way to jagged stone and fractured cliff walls. A canyon yawns open, dotted with countless dark holes.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: This is perfect for an ambush. Stay sharp. Move carefully. Eyes everywhere.

segments.speaker: Sherkan
segments.text: Or just let them try something. Saves us the trouble of looking.

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: The ley-line cuts straight through the rock here. It’s not just changing the plants anymore. The stone itself feels… wrong.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: Then we stay close, but not too close.

segments.speaker: SL
segments.text: You round a bend. A piercing screech tears through the canyon air—part bird, part beast, part something that should never exist.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: Down! Get to cover!

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: That is not a normal bird.

segments.speaker: Sherkan
segments.text: Sounds angry.

segments.speaker: Glymbar
segments.text: Sounds like fun.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: And how exactly do you plan to axe something that flies?

segments.speaker: Glymbar
segments.text: I’ll improvise.

segments.speaker: Sherkan
segments.text: He usually does.

segments.speaker: SL
segments.text: The sound echoes closer. Sherkan and Glymbar surge forward, momentum spell fueling their speed. Dust kicks beneath their boots. Oswin follows at a safer pace. Durrandir remains cautious, eyes scanning not just forward… but behind.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: This could be bait. Don’t get tunnel vision.

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: Then keep up. I’m not dying alone.

segments.speaker: SL
segments.text: The canyon widens into a stone hollow. At its center stands an ancient altar, blackened and burning. A wild man in tattered yellow-red robes screams curses at the sky, shaking his fists.

segments.speaker: Sherkan
segments.text: Finally.

segments.speaker: Glymbar
segments.text: Called it.

segments.speaker: Oswin
segments.text: This isn’t random cruelty. It’s enjoying this.

segments.speaker: Durrandir
segments.text: Then let’s end the joke.
